For many year (minimum 15years) Carried Amortised Cost QC/PC values have been set to zero for taxable corporate actions in the special accounting values. However Carried Amortised Cost Currency PC and Carried Amortised Cost Currency Correction PC where not zeroed. 
This had no practical influence on the accounting bookings and positions involved in the corporate action. But it has created unnecessary noise when validating changed results in internal batch job group results.
To avoid future noise Carried Amortised Cost Currency PC and Carried Amortised Cost Currency Correction PC will also be zeroed.

Performance Calculation has a check box named 'Decompose TWR into income and capital'. An income cash flow will be calculated if this is selected and the income cash flow can be affected by synthetic payments. Fixed calculation of I-spread for forward started bonds/swaps and/or bonds/swaps which are interest only or have non-bullet redemption structure. A simple data provider for Logical Form Tests (LFTs) is created. It respects the LFT architecture and enables searching for transaction data via the window ‘View Transactions’. It also enables the creation of new portfolios by copying existing ones. This complements and reduces the need for restricted exclusive access to AIDE_MASTER_AZ to persist specific test data for an LFT. It is possible to create new test data programmatically for LFTs by creating new transactions based on new portfolios in many but not necessarily all cases.

What are the problems/motivations for the changes?
When making partial reallocations for positions with a high number of tax lots then a rounding check could end up putting a too big correction on single tax lot. By too big it is meant above 2 times the smallest unit of the currency e.g. 0.02 for EUR or USD). This would cause the golden equation to fail for the corrected tax lot.
Secondly reallocation values for Initial Premium and Discount values could become incorrect.
Thirdly if a tax lot had an incorrect value for Balance Initial Premium and Discount and was fully sold a check would be made which could cause Balance Initial Premium and Discount not to go to zero on the tax lot.

What is the proposed solution?
First the rounding check has been improved so a single lot will not get more than 2 times the smallest unit of the currency. Then later golden equation checks on individual tax lot level will be able to ensure that the golden equation holds per tax lot. As a consequence the rounding check for reallocations will affect more tax lots.
Secondly a correction has been made to ensure correct reallocation values for Initial Premium and Discount values.
Thirdly a correction has been made so a check on Initial Premium and Discount values is not executed for fully sold tax lots.
